test.question: Loved and hated by thousands, Dr. Lucy Bertram may well be the most __________ physician ever to become surgeon general.
Over thousands of years, organisms have __________ many strategies to conserve water.
My cat is a creature of contradictions: __________ yet affectionate, __________ yet alert.
__________ for talking too much, the teacher __________ his reputation by keeping the class 30 minutes longer than the scheduled class time.
If Senator Montana runs for reelection next year, she will have the moneyraising advantage of the __________.
Using his own home as ______, Marlowe obtained a private loan that enabled him to _____ his financial obligations to the other partners and emerge free of debt.

The absurdist as opposed to the heroic treatment of war reached maturity in Catch-22, and the Vietnam War made this approach, which seemed so __________ and shocking, the only way to write about that conflict.
Because the issue is so insignificant, it was surprising that the disagreement among city council members was so ____.
Many thought Billy Eckstine's band _______ because its musicians were young, avant-garde jazzmen, while itslead singer crooned _______ popular ballads.
It is ________ to assume that if aspirin can prevent second heart attacks, it can also ______ an attack in the first place.
Cigars are not a safe ________ to cigarettes because, though cigar smokers do not inhale, they are still ________ higher rates of lung and mouth cancers than nonsmoker

Justices Marshall and Brennan opposed the death penalty on the grounds that it failed to __________ crimes, since all the available evidence made it clear that far more murders per capita were committed in states or countries with capital punishment than in those without it.
After the smoke and __________ of the city, Mr. Fitzgerald was glad to return to the __________ air and peace of the mountains.
A strike by Ford workers in Mexico poses a(n) __________ for the ruling party, which must choose between alienating its union ally or undermining its fight against inflation.
By combining an American cartoon character with Japanese traditions, the popular comic by Stan Sakai presents as a hero a samurai rabbit, a unique __________ of East and West.
A _________ that allowed voters to decide on the legality of casino gambling was passed by a(n) _______ 9-to-1 margin.
The __________ upon which this fine novel is developed with great __________ and intelligence is that nomales live beyond the age of 18.
The __________ use of washing machines and automobiles in the Middle Ages is part of the comedy of this high-spirited film.
Hoping to escape detection, Minnie __________ placed an ace in her sleeve while Rance shuffled the cards.
